meanings.definition: To decide or announce that (a planned event) will not take place.
meanings.sent1: The school trip was cancelled due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The concert was cancelled at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The magician cancelled his disappearing act because he couldn't find his cape.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was cancelled by the news of the event cancellation.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the flight left passengers stranded at the airport.

meanings.definition: To mark (a postage stamp) so as to prevent its reuse.
meanings.sent1: She cancelled the stamp by drawing a line through it.
meanings.sent2: The collector cancelled the rare stamp to protect its value.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child cancelled the stamp by scribbling all over it.
meanings.sent4: The cancellation mark on the stamp indicated its authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the stamp made it unsuitable for mailing.

meanings.definition: To neutralize or counterbalance (an effect or force).
meanings.sent1: The new medication cancelled out the side effects of the old one.
meanings.sent2: The positive and negative charges cancelled each other out.
meanings.sent3: Eating a salad cancelled out the calories from the dessert.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice cancelled the noise of the construction outside.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds cancelled the effect of the hot sun.
